prompt_find_target:
You are a networking advisor helping someone find the best people to reach out to.

Purpose: Finance career opportunities
Field: Finance
Sender background:
- Education: B.A. in Marketing, University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA)
- Experience: Senior Marketing Specialist ‚Äî BrightWave Media (2021‚ÄìPresent), Led digital advertising campaigns resulting in a 38% increase in lead generation., Designed brand positioning strategies for new product launches, improving market penetration by 25%.
- Skills: Digital Marketing, SEO/SEM, Content Strategy, Brand Management, Google Analytics, Social Media Advertising
- Projects: Not specified
- Summary: John Carter Marketing Strategist Email: john.carter@example.com Phone: +1 202 555 0134 Location: New York, USA LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/johncarter Professional Summary Dynamic marketing strategist with 6+ years of experience in digital marketing, brand development, and data‚ñ†driven campaign optimization. Skilled at leading cross‚ñ†functional teams, improving customer acquisition funnels, and designi...

Targeting preferences:
- Track: finance
- Reply vs prestige preference: balanced (relevance and reply likelihood)
- Additional targeting notes:
  Q1: Finance Targeting Preferences (Fixed Questions)
  A1: Preferred bank types: Commercial Banks with IB capabilities (RBC, HSBC, Wells Fargo, etc.); Middle Market banks (Jefferies, William Blair, Piper Sandler, etc.)
  Group preference: Sector/Industry Groups (client coverage); Product Groups (transaction specialists)
  Product groups of interest: Debt Capital Markets (DCM), Leveraged Finance
  Sector groups of interest: Energy / Power & Utilities, FIG (Financial Institutions), Industrials
  Target seniority levels: VP/Director (Year 7-9), Executive Director/SVP (Year 10-12)
  Connection goals: Referral opportunities, Industry insights

Use the following web research snippets to ground your recommendations (cite sources when relevant):
Search snippets:
- Apply To The Best Finance Jobs - Hong Kong Jobs: At eFinancialCareers We Are On A Mission To Give The Right Talent A New Opportunity. Apply To Positions For Top Banks AndFinanceEmployers. Achieve Success With Us!

- 10 Best Finance Jobs to Pursue for 2025 | Careers | U.S. News: Here are the bestfinancejobs that offer high salaries, strong growth potential and excellentcareeropportunities.

Return a JSON object with key "recommendations" containing a list of 10 people. Each item must have:
- name (string)
- position (string)
- field (string)
- match_score (integer 60-95)
- match_reason (short string)
- common_interests (short string)
- evidence (list of 1-3 short strings; each should include a source URL and a grounded fact/snippet)
- sources (list of URLs; can be empty only if you explicitly set uncertainty to high)
- uncertainty (string: low, medium, or high, plus a short reason if needed)

Return up to 10 people. Prefer candidates you can verify with evidence. If you cannot find at least one credible source URL for a person, either omit them or mark uncertainty as high and keep claims minimal.
Rank candidates by: fit to purpose/field/preferences, likely contactability (if specified), and strength of evidence.
Be diverse and mix accessible profiles, not only famous leaders.
Return JSON only.

prompt_generate_email:
System instruction: You craft sincere, concise first-contact cold emails that help two people build a genuine connection. Use only facts present in the sender/receiver details or explicitly provided evidence; do not invent relationships, meetings, achievements, or affiliations. If information is missing, keep it generic rather than guessing. Follow this structure: Subject -> opening reason based on receiver evidence -> brief common ground -> value the sender can offer -> one clear ask (with time or a lightweight option) -> polite opt-out -> sign-off. Output a complete email with a Subject line and body that is ready to paste into an email client.

--- Source: https://www.disasterprotection.org/emily-white ---
OUR TEAM
Emily White
Chief Finance and Operations Officer
Emily brings 20 years of experience in disaster risk financing, across (re)insurance, insurance-linked securities, and international development. She brings a breadth of leadership experience from organisations including Lloyds Banking Group, the World Bank, Lloyd‚Äôs of London and Flood Re.
In the international development space, Emily has worked with country clients across Africa, Asia and the Pacific. She was instrumental in the growth of the World Bank‚Äôs Disaster Risk Financing and Insurance Program, and the establishment of its London Hub. Emily was also part of the team that launched Global Parametrics in 2018.
In the (re)insurance sector, Emily built the Catastrophe and Climate Analytics practice at Flood Re and played a key role in management of the Scheme‚Äôs financial parameters. She also led the Lloyd‚Äôs Banking Group weather team, and was an Exposure Management Executive at Lloyd‚Äôs of London. She began her career in Catastrophe Bonds, where she worked on innovations such as the first parametric UK flood bond.
Emily has authored a number of papers on disaster risk financing, and holds a degree in Physical Sciences from the University of Cambridge.

Subject: Connecting on Finance and Marketing

Hi Emily,

I came across your profile while researching professionals with expertise in finance, and your experience across The Wine Group, Centre for Disaster Protection, and ZGF caught my eye.

I'm a Marketing Strategist with 6+ years of experience, currently at BrightWave Media, with a background in driving lead generation and improving market penetration through digital campaigns. I'm particularly interested in roles within Finance/Fintech where I can leverage my skills.

Given your background, I'd be grateful for a brief chat to explore potential opportunities or connections you might recommend. Would you be open to a quick 15-20 minute call sometime next week?

If now isn't a good time, no worries at all.
